byline.contributor: Falih Hassan reported from Baghdad, and Sewell Chan from London. Helene Cooper and Gardiner Harris contributed reporting from Washington, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo.
byline.original: By FALIH HASSAN and SEWELL CHAN

abstract: Iraqi troops retake most of western city of Ramadi, ending seven-month occupation by Islamic State; soldiers encounter fierce resistance by extremist fighters, and hold on city appears tenuous, but could prove to be pivotal.
lead_paragraph: The militants fled the western city’s government headquarters, although pockets of resistance remained in the north and east.

headline.main: Iraqi Victory Over ISIS in Ramadi Could Prove Pivotal
headline.print_headline: Iraqis Retake Center of City in Grip of ISIS

snippet: The militants fled the western city’s government headquarters, although pockets of resistance remained in the north and east.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
